definition: to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke
to force a smile/a bitter laugh
lit. not to know whether to laugh or cry (idiom)/both funny and extremely embarrassing/between laughter and tears
to laugh heartily/to burst into loud laughter

sentences.english: Bll the boys laughed to hear the good news.
sentences.chinese: 聽見這個好動靜然後，所有的男孩都笑了。

sentences.english: Heartless laugh, was the best thing that I have.
sentences.chinese: 隃罏沒心沒肺的笑，是我擁有的最美好的東西。

sentences.english: Laughing and talking, they went to the room.
sentences.chinese: 他們又說又笑地走進了房間。

sentences.english: The room was then full of people chatting animatedly and laughing .
sentences.chinese: 這時滿屋子的人又說又笑，興高采烈。

sentences.english: The true night suddenly smiled to make a noise.
It is difficult for us to refrain from laughing when we are seeing a comedy.
sentences.chinese: 在我們觀看喜劇時，很難忍住不笑。

sentences.english: Idou't promise to ask you to stop…But I can run with you.
sentences.chinese: 我不保證會使你笑，但我可以陪着你一起哭。

sentences.english: Laughter is powerful medicine, so laugh often.
sentences.chinese: 笑聲是最好的良藥，所以要經常笑。

sentences.english: Stubborn smiled, said, rarely going at once, to accompany her.
sentences.chinese: 倔強的笑着，說，難得去一次，好好陪她啊。

sentences.english: Woods never liked the black widow this is gratitude toward her smiling.
sentences.chinese: 嗚茲從來都不喜歡黑寡婦，這次卻感激地朝着她笑了。

sentences.english: You said, you like to see me laugh, even the Heartbreakers laugh.
sentences.chinese: 你說，你喜歡看我笑，即使是撕心裂肺的笑。

sentences.english: You said, you like to see me laugh, even the Heartbreakers laugh.
sentences.chinese: 你說，你喜歡看我笑，即使是撕心裂肺的笑。

sentences.english: He says he expects to be drowned in laughter.
sentences.chinese: 他表示已料想到會被笑死。

sentences.english: I guess there are advantages toshavingstwo big buckteeth. It always looks like he's smiling.
sentences.chinese: 長着這種門牙有一個好處，讓人感覺他老是在微微笑。

sentences.english: The female kid smiles very a color color.

definition: to giggle/to laugh foolishly/to smirk/to simper
to laugh heartily/to burst into loud laughter
to sway to and fro/to rock back and forth
to stay/to stop/to tease (play with)/amusing/short pause in reading aloud, equivalent to comma (also written 讀|读[dou4])
